text.p: Rockwell International Corp said Thursday it plans to consolidate its Collins commercial and government avionics businesses and its communication systems division into one organization.

Effective Oct. 1, both Collins divisions, based in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, and the communications systems division, based in Dallas, Texas, will be consolidated into a division called Avionics and Communications to be headquartered in Cedar Rapids.
A spokesman fo the company said the move is hoped to position the companies for future opportunities and that no job losses are anticipated.
The businesses are expected to generate sales of nearly $1.7 billion in fiscal 1996 and employ a total of 11,600 people, the company said in a statement.
Jack Cosgrove, who had headed Collins Avionics and Communications, was named president of Avionics and Communications.
Collins Avionics and Communications and the communications systems division were formerly part of Rockwell's aerospace and defense organization, which was sold to the Boeing Co on August 1.
(Corrects to clarify which units were part of aerospace and defense operations)
Among other things the companies provide military communications systems, air traffic management systems and pioneered the development of Global Positioning System technology.
Shares of Rockwell closed 3/8 higher at 56-1/2 on the New York Stock Exchange.
